001package edu.pdx.cs410J.whitlock;
002
003import edu.pdx.cs410J.whitlock.Student.InvalidGpaException;
004import edu.pdx.cs410J.whitlock.Student.UnrecognizedGenderException;
005import org.hamcrest.core.StringContains;
006import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
007
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009
010import static org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat;
011import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.containsString;
012import static org.hamcrest.core.IsEqual.equalTo;
013import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertThrows;
014
015/**
016 * Unit tests for the Student class.  In addition to the JUnit annotations,
017 * they also make use of the <a href="http://hamcrest.org/JavaHamcrest/">hamcrest</a>
018 * matchers for more readable assertion statements.
019 */
020public class StudentTest
021{
022
023  @Test
024  void studentNamedPatIsNamedPat() {
025    String name = "Pat";
026    var pat = createStudentNamed(name);
027    assertThat(pat.getName(), equalTo(name));
028  }
029
030  @Test
031  void nameLongerThan40CharactersThrowsIllegalArgumentException() {
032    String tooLongName = "12345678901234567890123456789012345678901";
033    assertThrows(IllegalArgumentException.class, () -> createStudentNamed(tooLongName));
034  }
035
036  private Student createStudentNamed(String studentName) {
037    return new Student(studentName, new ArrayList<>(), 0.0, "other");
038  }
039
040  @Test
041  void femaleGenderHasShePronoun() {
042    Student femaleStudent = createStudentWithGender(Student.FEMALE_GENDER);
043    assertThat(femaleStudent.toString(), containsString(Student.FEMALE_PRONOUN));
044  }
045
046  private Student createStudentWithGender(String gender) {
047    return new Student("Name", new ArrayList<>(), 0.0, gender);
048  }
049
050  @Test
051  void maleGenderHasHePronoun() {
052    Student maleStudent = createStudentWithGender(Student.MALE_GENDER);
053    assertThat(maleStudent.toString(), containsString(Student.MALE_PRONOUN));
054  }
055
056  @Test
057  void otherGenderHasTheyPronoun() {
058    Student maleStudent = createStudentWithGender(Student.OTHER_GENDER);
059    assertThat(maleStudent.toString(), containsString(Student.THEY_PRONOUN));
060  }
061
062  @Test
063  void otherGenderCaseInsensitiveHasTheyPronoun() {
064    Student maleStudent = createStudentWithGender("OTHER");
065    assertThat(maleStudent.toString(), containsString(Student.THEY_PRONOUN));
066  }
067
068  @Test
069  void unrecognizedGenderThrowsUnrecognizedGenderException() {
070    String unrecognizedGender = "unsupported";
071    UnrecognizedGenderException ex =
072      assertThrows(UnrecognizedGenderException.class, () -> createStudentWithGender(unrecognizedGender));
073    assertThat(ex.getMessage(), containsString(unrecognizedGender));
074  }
075
076  @Test
077  void toStringContainsStudentName() {
078    String studentName = "Dave";
079    Student dave = createStudentNamed(studentName);
080    assertThat(dave.toString(), containsString(studentName));
081  }
082
083  @Test
084  void tooLargeGpaThrowAnInvalidGpaException() {
085    double invalidGpa = 4.01;
086    InvalidGpaException ex =
087      assertThrows(InvalidGpaException.class, () -> createStudentWithGpa(invalidGpa));
088    assertThat(ex.getMessage(), containsString(String.valueOf(invalidGpa)));
089
090  }
091
092  @Test
093  void saysIsNotImplementedYet() {
094    Student student = createStudentWithGpa(4.0);
095    assertThrows(UnsupportedOperationException.class, student::says);
096  }
097
098  private Student createStudentWithGpa(double gpa) {
099    return new Student("Name", new ArrayList<>(), gpa, "other");
100  }
101
102  @Test
103  void toStringContainsGpa() {
104    double gpa = 3.45;
105    Student student = createStudentWithGpa(gpa);
106    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString(" has a gpa of " + gpa));
107  }
108
109  @Test
110  void toStringContainsEnrolledClasses() {
111    String class1 = "Operating Systems";
112    String class2 = "Compilers";
113    String class3 = "Algorithms";
114
115    ArrayList<String> classes = new ArrayList<>();
116    classes.add(class1);
117    classes.add(class2);
118    classes.add(class3);
119
120    Student student = new Student("Name", classes, 3.45, "other");
121    String toString = student.toString();
122
123    assertThat(toString, StringContains.containsString(class1));
124    assertThat(toString, StringContains.containsString(class2));
125    assertThat(toString, StringContains.containsString(class3));
126  }
127}
